questions.title: Moving Average from Data Stream
questions.prompt: Given a stream of sensor readings, implement a class `MovingAverage` that computes the average of the last `N` values. Optimize for time complexity.
followups: What data structure allows O(1) update and retrieval of the average?
How would you modify this to compute the median instead of the mean?
What if the window size is extremely large (e.g., 1 million readings)?

questions.title: Valid Palindrome (Car VIN Check)
questions.prompt: A vehicle identification number (VIN) is being processed. Explain how you would check if a given string reads the same forwards and backwards, ignoring non-alphanumeric characters.
followups: How do you handle case sensitivity?
What is the time and space complexity?
Can you solve this without using extra space for filtering?

questions.title: FizzBuzz (Tesla Edition)
questions.prompt: Implement FizzBuzz. However, if a number is a multiple of 3, print 'Tesla'. If a multiple of 5, print 'Motors'. If a multiple of both, print 'TeslaMotors'.
followups: What is the time complexity?
How would you extend this to support additional rules (e.g., multiples of 7)?
What is the simplest way to avoid repetitive modulus operations?

questions.title: Merge Sorted Arrays (Battery Cells)
questions.prompt: You have two sorted lists representing the charge levels of individual battery cells in a pack. Merge them into one sorted list without using built-in sort functions.
followups: What is the time and space complexity?
How would you merge K sorted lists?
What if one list is much larger than the other?

questions.title: Remove Duplicates from Sorted Array (Firmware Updates)
questions.prompt: A list of firmware version numbers is sorted. Remove duplicates in-place and return the new length.
followups: Why is the two-pointer approach efficient here?
What if the array is unsorted?
How do you handle memory constraints for embedded systems?

questions.title: First Unique Character (Telemetry Signal)
questions.prompt: Given a string of telemetry signal IDs, find the first non-repeating character and return its index. If it doesn't exist, return -1.
followups: What is the time complexity of a single-pass vs two-pass approach?
How would you handle a stream of infinite characters?
What data structure minimizes memory usage?

questions.title: Plus One (Odometer Increment)
questions.prompt: An array represents the digits of a vehicle's odometer reading. Increment the odometer by one and return the resulting array.
followups: What is the worst-case scenario (e.g., [9,9,9])?
How do you handle the carry operation efficiently?
Can you solve it without converting the array to an integer?

questions.title: Linked List Cycle Detection (CAN Bus)
questions.prompt: A Controller Area Network (CAN) bus log is represented as a linked list. Determine if there is a cycle in the log (indicative of a data loop error).
followups: Why does Floyd's Tortoise and Hare algorithm work?
What is the space complexity of your approach?
How do you find the node where the cycle begins?

questions.title: Stack using Queues (Charge Scheduling)
questions.prompt: Implement a LIFO stack using only two FIFO queues. This models a charge scheduling buffer.
followups: What is the time complexity of push and pop in your implementation?
Can you optimize one operation to be O(1)?
What are the trade-offs between making push vs pop expensive?

questions.title: OOP: Encapsulation (Battery Management System)
questions.prompt: Design a `BatteryCell` class. It should have a state of charge (SOC) and a temperature. Explain how you would use encapsulation to prevent invalid states (e.g., SOC below 0% or above 100%).
followups: Why are private fields important here?
How do you validate input in setter methods?
Would you use an interface or an abstract class for different battery chemistries (NMC, LFP)?

questions.title: OOP: Polymorphism (Autopilot Sensor Fusion)
questions.prompt: Tesla uses cameras, radar, and ultrasonic sensors. Design a `Sensor` interface and implement concrete classes for `Camera`, `Radar`, and `Ultrasonic`. Explain how polymorphism simplifies adding new sensor types.
followups: What common method would the interface define (e.g., `readData()`)?
How does this adhere to the Open-Closed Principle?
Where would you use dependency injection here?

questions.title: SDLC: Agile vs Waterfall
questions.prompt: Explain the difference between Agile and Waterfall software development life cycles. Which one is more suitable for Tesla's Autopilot firmware updates?
followups: What are the advantages of Agile in a fast-paced environment?
How do you handle requirement changes in Agile?
What is a sprint retrospective?

questions.title: Black-box vs White-box Testing
questions.prompt: What is the difference between black-box and white-box testing? When would you use each for validating a vehicle's infotainment system?
followups: Which one is more effective for finding security vulnerabilities?
How do you test a function without knowing its internal implementation?
What is code coverage and which testing method does it relate to?

questions.title: Why Tesla? (Intern Focus)
questions.prompt: Why do you want to intern at Tesla? What specific aspect of Tesla's mission or technology drives you?
followups: Which Tesla product or feature do you admire most and why?
How do you align with Tesla's 'First Principles' problem-solving approach?
What do you know about Tesla's energy business (Solar, Megapack) vs automotive?

questions.title: Behavioral: Difficult Problem Solved
questions.prompt: Tell me about the most difficult technical problem you have solved. Be specific about your approach and the outcome.
followups: What was the root cause of the problem?
How did you validate your solution?
What would you have done differently in hindsight?

questions.title: Behavioral: Taking Initiative
questions.prompt: Describe a time when you took initiative to solve a problem that was not in your job description or assigned to you.
followups: Why did you decide to take ownership?
How did you balance this with your core responsibilities?
What was the impact of your initiative?
